Nodes.NPCDialogue: Is that..? It is you! What are you doing here, Hallo-- friend? Shhh! Speak softly. The walls have ears. I must refrain from calling you by your rightful title, I'm afraid. I must ask you to do the same for me.

The army arrived shortly after you had fled. Their orders were to capture everyone in the Chapel, but that was not their sole focus. On the way here, they killed anyone who resisted. Raped those they got their hands on. No matter who that was. Even now, I... I can hear the screams...
They rounded up all of us who remained in the Chapel. We were offered mercy in exchange for renouncing our faith. Many of us... they refused. Brave men and women, all. Executed on the spot.
If you hadn't, you would have died with the others. Or become... this.
They've kept their promise. They kept us alive. But our word was not good enough. They had to make us comply.

Most are alive. It was not the army's goal to wipe us out, after all. They did have to make an example out of those who proved defiant, however... You must have passed the burned down house on the way here.
We are slowly adjusting to our new way of life. Some of us even prefer it. The promise of security, the connection to the global Hegemony. The stability that faith alone couldn't provide.
It was inevitable, was it not? No one was ever meant to answer our prayers.
Aye. I have seen all you have. But you haven't seen what I have.

I lied to the army, so I could live to see the rise of our culture once more. Instead, I was turned into this. If I could turn back time, I would have chosen to die side by side with the fellow faithful.

I have almost forgotten what it is like to dream. I cannot bear to do this in vain again. You must leave, my friend. Leave, and never come back. At least, then, I'll take comfort that one of us is free.

Ever noble. And foolish, to boot. Precisely the kind the Hegemony kills first. And yet, I see the spark in your eyes, and it fills my heart with warmth. Perhaps I am a fool as well. Or perhaps there is still a chance we will persevere. As we have done before.
So am I, my friend. So am I. Now, please, go. Before they notice you.

And I could not be happier to embrace oblivion at the hands of the one I admire the most. But even though we are seen as lesser, they will not tolerate crime. Should you strike me down, they will not rest until they find the perpetrator. And then... I dare not think what they will do to you. No, my friend. You must flee. You must be the one who lives on.
I... Thank you. I wish I had any way to repay your kindness. May the Gate and the Key have mercy on your soul, Hallowed One. Goodbye.
They did. And He did nothing.
Quiet! I'm begging you! They must not hear you. If they hear you, if they catch you, you will either be dead, or... this.
Quiet! Please! Aye, it is gone. Demolished before my very eyes. My heart aches still at the memory of it...

Edges.PlayerDialogue: What happened here, Caleb? What have they done to you?
What about the rest of the village?
Have you renounced our faith in earnest? Having seen all I have seen?
We will rise once more. I will do everything in my power to make it happen. Don't give up hope, Caleb.
No. I will not agree to flee again. If they catch me, so be it. I will not leave my people.
I have failed you. I have failed you all. I am truly sorry.
If death is your wish, I can grant you a merciful one.
No. I am tired of running. If it is my fate to die, I shall do it on my terms. I will not let you suffer any longer.
I am sorry, Caleb. I am truly sorry.
Words of a coward. Our brothers and sisters died for the god you are disrespecting.
The Hegemony will pay for this. I swear it.
WHAT ARE YOU FUCKING TALKING ABOUT
Gate have mercy, Caleb! The Chapel...
